articles.description: Europe's players want Luke Donald to remain their Ryder Cup captain after regaining Ryder Cup with a 16½-11½ victory over the United States in Rome.
articles.title: 'Two more years' - Europe winners want Donald to stay

articles.description: Michael Beale has left his role as Rangers manager after slipping seven points behind Celtic after seven games of the season.
articles.title: Beale sacked by Rangers after third defeat in seven

articles.description: Liverpool have released a statement saying VAR's error in the defeat to Tottenham has undermined sporting integrity.
articles.title: 'VAR error undermined sporting integrity' - Liverpool

articles.description: Watch key moments as Europe regain the Ryder Cup with victory over the United States in Rome.
articles.title: Watch: Key moments as Europe regain Ryder Cup

articles.description: Miri Taylor's second-half strike gives Liverpool a surprise 1-0 Women's Super League win at Arsenal in front of 54,115 fans.
articles.title: Liverpool win at Arsenal in front of record crowd

articles.description: Rory McIlroy fights back tears of joy instead of disappointment after contributing a career-best performance to help Europe regain the Ryder Cup.
articles.title: Row 'fuels' emotional McIlroy in Ryder Cup redemption

articles.description: Simone Biles becomes the first woman to execute a Yurchenko double pike vault on her return to the World Gymnastics Championships in Antwerp.
articles.title: Biles makes history on World Championships return

articles.description: Jermaine Jenas feels Nottingham Forest are still a work in progress under Steve Cooper but he is convinced they will stay clear of the relegation battle.
articles.title: 'Cooper's culture means Forest won't struggle again'

articles.description: American Mia Fishel scores on her debut as Chelsea begin their title defence with an entertaining derby victory over Tottenham at Stamford Bridge.
articles.title: Fishel's 'dream' debut gives Chelsea winning start

articles.description: Australia keep their slim hopes of reaching the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals alive with a win over Portugal in their final Pool C match.
articles.title: Australia keep knockout hopes alive with Portugal win
